page.title: 09The Spon Street Scheme
page.content: This is in the area known as Spon End .In 1966 the council decided to preserve some of Coventry's oldest buildings by relocating them all in one place. Many of them are Medieval and Tudor houses brought from all corners of Coventry. Originally Spon St. was the centre of the watch-making industry in Coventry. Even earlier it was know for weaving cloth, and that is why many of the buildings (top shops) have large upper windows. The upper floors were used as work rooms and needed a lot of light. One road leading off Spon St. is called Watch Close. Not all of Spon St. is used for preserving houses because it is cut in half by the Coventry ring road. Most of the preserved houses are used as shops.
